page.description: Generates a QR Code from a string.
page.syntax: qrcode as P = printQRCode (value as C [, sizeInPixels as N [, flagURLEncodeValue as L ]])

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value to encode in the QR Code image.

description.p: The size of the QR Code, in pixels.
Defines whether or not the value should be url encoded.

discussion.p: The *[xb:printQRCode]* function generates a QR Code image for a given value. You can optionally specify the size of the image and whether or not the value should be url encoded.
This method requires an internet connection because the Google Charts API is called to render the QR code.

description.p: The example below shows a calculated field for a Report that creates a QR Code 300 pixels in size and contains the value of two fields, *[xb:firstname]* and *[xb:lastname]*.
